shredder 0.1.0

Working With brms

Source: vignettes/brms.Rmd
brms.Rmd
library(shredder)
library(brms)

Generate Data

group <- rep(c("treat", "placebo"), 
             each = 30)

symptom_post <- c(
  rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 2), 
  rnorm(30, mean = 0, sd = 1)
)

dat1 <- data.frame(group, symptom_post)

Run Model

fit <- brm(bf(symptom_post ~ group, sigma ~ group), 
           data = dat1, 
           family = gaussian())
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 4000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.02931   0.16798 -0.30049  0.35827 1.00052     5776     3077
sigma_Intercept  -0.10432   0.13125 -0.35094  0.16050 1.00162     3645     2672
grouptreat        1.41634   0.44980  0.52624  2.31367 1.00206     2550     2233
sigma_grouptreat  0.90519   0.18651  0.54653  1.26927 1.00238     3558     3132

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Select first 100 Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_slice <- fit%>%stan_slice(1:100)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1100; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 400

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.02048   0.17323 -0.30248  0.37047 1.02906      817      247
sigma_Intercept  -0.10454   0.13323 -0.34172  0.16497 1.00669      490      232
grouptreat        1.48102   0.47753  0.59680  2.54047 1.03710      247      158
sigma_grouptreat  0.90739   0.18177  0.51392  1.24278 0.99527      692      417

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_slice%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Sample 25% of Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_sample <- fit%>%
  stan_sample_frac(0.25)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1250; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.03355   0.16677 -0.28807  0.36060 1.00378     1027      985
sigma_Intercept  -0.10141   0.13086 -0.33967  0.16235 1.00108      926      784
grouptreat        1.40514   0.44788  0.51913  2.31372 1.00403     1012     1031
sigma_grouptreat  0.90262   0.18019  0.53888  1.24459 1.00898      940      942

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_sample%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional

fit_filter <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=2)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1076; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 304

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.09028   0.16494 -0.42261  0.22397 0.99067      299      261
sigma_Intercept  -0.09845   0.13956 -0.36194  0.13737 1.00224      289      274
grouptreat        2.24014   0.20394  2.00669  2.76915 1.00409      246      264
sigma_grouptreat  0.93929   0.19150  0.55702  1.26675 0.99409      300      246

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional Subset Chain

fit_filter_chain <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=2)%>%
  stan_retain(chains = 1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 1 chains, each with iter = 1076; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 76

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.08777   0.17412 -0.42982  0.20926 0.98941       60       87
sigma_Intercept  -0.09028   0.13717 -0.32221  0.14083 0.99267       72       84
grouptreat        2.27061   0.21517  2.01614  2.83151 1.00006       82       38
sigma_grouptreat  0.95553   0.20488  0.58341  1.36927 0.99782       74       55

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Eff.Sample 
is a crude measure of effective sample size, and Rhat is the potential 
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter_chain%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)
